Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
orgasm \or"gasm\ ([^o]r"g[a^]z'm), n. [F. orgasme; cf. Gr. 'orgasmo`s a kneading, softening, prob. confused with 'orga^n to swell, especially with lust; to feel an ardent desire.] (Physiol.) Eager or immoderate excitement or action; the state of turgescence of any organ; erethism. [1913 Webster]
2. Especially: The peak of the physical pleasurable sexual excitement caused by stimulation of the sexual organs, as in intercourse; in the male, it is usually accompanied by ejaculation. [1913 Webster +PJC]
3. Hence: An eruption of intense, uncontrolled excitement; -- used of groups and individuals. [PJC]
orgasm n : the moment of most intense pleasure in sexual intercourse [syn: {climax}, {sexual climax}, {coming}]
